message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.EC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with mechanism design, which is a subfield of game theory (cs.GT). It also involves set systems and graph theory, which are topics in algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The use of spectral techniques suggests a connection to linear algebra and optimization, which are relevant to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and economics (cs.EC). Finally, the paper discusses frugality, which is a measure of efficiency, and proposes a uniform scheme for designing frugal mechanisms, which could be considered a form of optimization or system design (cs.SI).
